Package net.minestom.server.utils.binary

Class BinaryWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.OutputStream
      • net.minestom.server.utils.binary.BinaryWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.io.Flushable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public class BinaryWriter
extends java.io.OutputStream
    Class used to write to a byte array. WARNING: not thread-safe.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      BinaryWriter()
      Creates a BinaryWriter with a "reasonably small initial capacity".
      BinaryWriter​(int initialCapacity)
      Creates a BinaryWriter using a heap buffer with a custom initial capacity.
      BinaryWriter​(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer)
      Creates a BinaryWriter from multiple a single buffer.
      BinaryWriter​(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf... buffers)
      Creates a BinaryWriter from multiple buffers.

      • writeVarIntArray

        public void writeVarIntArray​(int[] array)
        Writes a var-int array to the buffer.

        It is sized by another var-int at the beginning.

        Parameters:
        array - the integers to write

      • writeBytes

        public void writeBytes​(@NotNull
                       byte[] bytes)
        Writes a byte array.

        WARNING: it doesn't write the length of bytes.

        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte array to write

      • writeStringArray

        public void writeStringArray​(@NotNull
                             java.lang.String[] array)
        Writes a string to the buffer.

        The array is sized by a var-int and all strings are wrote using writeSizedString(String).

        Parameters:
        array - the string array to write

        public void writeUuid​(@NotNull
                      java.util.UUID uuid)
